http://dx.doi.org/10.1080/02724634.2012.686467@                  ABSTRACT—The plesiosaur specimen NHMUK OR49202, from the Lias Group of Lyme Regis, consists of a complete
http://dx.doi.org/10.1080/02724634.2012.686467@                  to Plesiosaurus and comparison with the type specimen of ‘Plesiosaurus’ macrocephalus (NHMUK OR1336) suggests that
http://dx.doi.org/10.1080/02724634.2012.686467@                  it is taxonomically distinct. Therefore, NHMUK OR49202 is made the holotype of a new genus and species: Anningasaura
http://dx.doi.org/10.1080/02724634.2012.686467@                           the Lias Group of Lyme Regis, Dorset, England (NHMUK
